snippet: Ten Turkish citizens were among those arrested in Shanghai and accused of providing altered Turkish passports to nine Uighurs trying to flee the country, a state-run newspaper reported.
abstract: Shanghai police arrest 10 Turkish citizens and two Chinese citizens and charge them with giving altered Turkish passports to Uighur terrorist suspects in Xinjiang region; suspects, who were attempting to leave country with passports, are also arrested.

byline.contributor: Mia Li and Bree Feng contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Ten Turkish citizens were among those arrested in Shanghai and accused of providing altered Turkish passports to nine Uighurs trying to flee the country, a state-run newspaper reported.

headline.main: Turks Are Held in Plot to Help Uighurs Leave China
headline.print_headline: Turks Are Held in Plot to Help Uighurs Leave China
